title: Football (Soccer)
description: Football, also known as soccer, is a team sport played between two teams of eleven players with a spherical ball. It is the most popular sport in the world.
key_rules: The game is played in two halves of 45 minutes each.
The objective is to score goals by getting the ball into the opposing team's net.
Only the goalkeeper is allowed to use their hands to touch the ball within their penalty area.

title: Cricket
description: Cricket is a bat-and-ball game played between two teams of eleven players on a field with a 22-yard pitch at its center. The sport is known for its strategic depth and diverse formats.
popularity: Popular in countries like India, Australia, England, and South Africa.
key_rules: Each team takes turns to bat and bowl, with the aim of scoring runs or dismissing players.
A match can be played in various formats, including Test matches, One Day Internationals, and T20s.
Runs are scored by hitting the ball and running between the wickets, or by hitting the ball to the boundary.

title: Basketball
description: Basketball is a team sport where two teams of five players each try to score by shooting a ball through the opponent's hoop. The sport is known for its fast pace and high scoring.
popularity: Popular in the United States, China, and Europe.
key_rules: The game is played in four quarters of 12 minutes each.
Points are scored by shooting the ball through the hoop from various distances, with 1, 2, or 3 points awarded.
Players must dribble the ball while moving and cannot take more than two steps without bouncing the ball.

title: Tennis
description: Tennis is a racket sport that can be played individually against a single opponent or between two teams of two players each. The objective is to hit the ball over the net into the opponent's court.
popularity: Popular worldwide, especially in Europe, North America, and Australia.
origin: France, 12th century (modern form developed in England in the late 19th century)
key_rules: Matches are played in sets, with players needing to win a certain number of sets to win the match.
Points are scored when the opponent fails to return the ball within the allowed boundaries.
Players alternate serves every game, with the serve switching to the other player after every set.

title: Baseball
description: Baseball is a bat-and-ball game played between two teams of nine players each. The goal is to score runs by hitting the ball and running around a series of four bases arranged in a diamond shape.
popularity: Popular in the United States, Japan, and Latin America.
key_rules: The game is played over nine innings, with each team having a chance to bat and field.
Runs are scored by hitting the ball and running to touch the bases in sequence.
The defensive team tries to get outs by catching the ball, throwing it to a base, or striking out the batter.

title: Rugby
description: Rugby is a contact team sport that originated in England. It is played with an oval ball that players can carry, kick, and pass with the aim of scoring tries or kicking goals.
popularity: Popular in countries like New Zealand, South Africa, England, and Australia.
key_rules: The game is played in two halves of 40 minutes each.
Players can run with the ball or kick it but can only pass it backward.
Points are scored by grounding the ball in the opponent's in-goal area (a try) or by kicking it through the goalposts.
